feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued August 27 at 5:42PM AKDT until August 28 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves will wash surf to the top of the beach. * WHERE...Chukchi Sea Coast from Shishmaref to Cape Espenberg. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Beach erosion will occur. Items left on the beach

entry.title: Flood Watch issued August 27 at 3:51PM AKDT until August 28 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Including the following areas, Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys and Upper Koyukuk Valley and Brooks Range from the Dalton Highway west. This includes the cities of Ambler, Shungnak, Kobuk,
entry.cap:areaDesc: Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Koyukuk Valley

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued August 27 at 3:06PM AKDT until August 27 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... ...WIND ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...Southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 65 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range. * WHEN...Until 10 PM AKDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects.

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued August 27 at 3:06PM AKDT until August 28 at 1:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Southwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * WHERE...Along the Alaska Highway from Tok west. * WHEN...Until 1 AM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree could be blown down and a few power outages may result.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 27 at 2:53PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Heavy rains in the Kroto Creek and Moose Creek Basins have cause rapid rises and lowland flooding across the area. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Kroto Creek and Moose Creek covering the Oilwell Road area. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM AKDT Monday.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued August 27 at 1:01PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by ongoing runoff from excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Including the following area, the western reaches of the Susitna Valley. This includes the locations along the Skwentna and Yentna Rivers.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued August 27 at 7:42AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR MARICOPA COUNTY INCLUDING THE PHOENIX METRO AREA MONDAY... The Arizona Department of Environmental Quality (ADEQ) has issued an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for the Phoenix Metro Area on Monday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 9:18PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Otero, central Crowley and east central Pueblo Counties through 1000 PM MDT... At 918 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles north of Crowley to near Manzanola to 11 miles northwest of Timpas. Movement was east at 15 mph.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Crowley County; La Junta Vicinity, Otero County; Pueblo Vicinity, Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet
